questions.text: A 42-year-old multiparous obese woman presents with abdominal pain. Physical examination and her radiograph reveal that large gallstones have ulcerated through the posterior wall of the fundus of the gallbladder into the intestine. Which of the following parts of the intestine is most likely to initially contain gallstones?
Which of the following statements regarding feedback control is incorrect?

options.label: A
options.text: Most control systems act by negative feedback

options.label: B
options.text: Positive feedback mechanisms usually promote stability in a system

options.label: C
options.text: Generation of nerve action potentials involves positive feedback

options.label: D
options.text: Feed-forward control is important in regulating motor activity

questions.correct_answer: B. Positive feedback mechanisms usually promote stability in a system

questions.text: Blood is transfused into a patient whose baroreceptors are not functioning. The bp in this individual increases from 100 to 150 mm Hg. The same volume of blood is later transfused into another individual whose baroreceptors are functional. The increase in bp in the second individual is from 100 to 125 mm Hg. What is approximate feedback ‘gain’ of the arterial baroreceptors in the second individual when they are functioning normally?

A clinical assessment team determined that the child had malignant hyperthermia (MH). The MH crisis is associated with which of the following/
Increases in both renal blood flow and GFR are caused by which of the following?
questions.correct_answer: A. Dilatation of the afferent arterioles

questions.text: A man lost his right hand in a road accident. 2 months later he has episodes of shooting pain in his missing limb (phantom limb pain). A detailed PET scan of his cerebral cortex will show

options.label: B
options.text: Expansion of his right hand area in his left somatic sensory area

options.label: C
options.text: Projection of the fibers from neighboring sensory areas into the right hand area of his left S1

questions.correct_answer: C. Projection of the fibers from neighboring sensory areas into the right hand area of his left S1

questions.text: A 22-year-old college student presents with severe abdominal pain. Temperature is 101.6 F. after abdominal examination and imaging a diagnosis of acute appendicitis was made. Which of the following mediator cannot cause the the clinical sign seen in this patient?

questions.text: A 44-year old male was being transfused blood and has now presented with anaphylactic shock. The physician successfully treats the emergency condition. On detailed history he also had similar reaction to blood product during previous transfusion 1 year back. Further he also complains of frequent cough cold from the time of his childhood which occurs for a prolonged period and sometimes consumes antibiotics for the same. He also says he has increased stool frequency and watery stools for many days in a month. His weight is 43 Kg and Height is 146 cms. Which of the following is not true in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Duodenal biopsy can show villous atrophy and crypt hyperplasia.

options.label: B
options.text: The disease is inherited in an XL recessive pattern

options.label: C
options.text: This patient requires washed P-RBC for further transfusion

questions.correct_answer: B. The disease is inherited in an XL recessive pattern

questions.text: A 4-year child is diagnosed of acute lymphoblastic leukaemia. Which of the following is true about this condition?

options.label: B
options.text: It is a type IV hypersensitivity reaction

options.label: C
options.text: Patients bilirubin is likely to be elevated

options.label: D
options.text: It occurs due to ABO mismatch between donor and recipient.

questions.correct_answer: D. It occurs due to ABO mismatch between donor and recipient.

questions.text: True about Klinefelter syndrome are all except?

options.label: A
options.text: Maternal non Disjunction of chromosome X is always the cause

options.label: B
options.text: Failure of lyonisation of SHOX gene leads to tall stature and long legs.

options.label: C
options.text: Selective lyonisation of Androgen receptor with shorter CAG repeats leads to insensitization

questions.correct_answer: A. Maternal non Disjunction of chromosome X is always the cause

A 55 year male presented to medical emergency with chest pain for last 10-12 hours, he was locally given aspirin in his village by the local physician. A ECG shows evidence of myocardial infarction. He was treated with various medications in emergency including tenecteplase. He dies four hours later. A postmortem examination was done and histology of heart infarct is as shown in the image. What is the mot likely inference from the image?

options.label: A
options.text: There was severe hypoxia causing death

options.label: B
options.text: There were free radicals produced which led to more severe damage of myocardium

options.label: C
options.text: The infarct is 1-3 days old based on the histology

options.label: D
options.text: The cause of death is unlikely to be myocardial infarction

questions.correct_answer: B. There were free radicals produced which led to more severe damage of myocardium

A research scientist is comparing surface antigens X and Y that come from 2 different viruses. He obtains antibodies against antigen X from an animal previously exposed to the virus expressing this antigen. These antibodies are then attached to assay plates. Next, a fixed quantity of radiolabeled X antigen is added to the plates. Unlabeled Y antigens are then added in increasing concentrations to each plate, and the plates are washed to remove unbound antigens. Radioactivity is plotted as a function of Y antigen concentration, as shown in the graph below. Which of the following best describes the results of this experiment?

options.label: A
options.text: Antigen X and antigen Y have no epitopes in common

options.label: B
options.text: Antigen X and antigen Y have the same epitopes

options.label: C
options.text: Antigen Y shares most of the epitopes of antigen X

options.label: D
options.text: Antigen Y shares some of the epitopes of antigen X

questions.correct_answer: A. Antigen X and antigen Y have no epitopes in common

A 70-year-old patient with long-standing type 2 diabetes mellitus presents with complaints of pain in the left ear with purulent drainage. On physical examination, the patient is afebrile. A 35-year-old previously healthy man develops cough with purulent sputum over several days. On presentation to the emergency room temperature is 39°C (102°F), pulse is 110, and blood pressure is 100/70 mm Hg. He has rales and dullness to percussion at the left base. There is no rash. Flexion of the patient’s neck when supine results in spontaneous flexion of hip and knee. Neurologic examination is non-focal. There is no papilledema. A lumbar puncture is performed in the emergency room. The cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) shows 8000 leukocytes/μL, 90% of which are polymorphonuclear cells. Glucose is 30 mg/dL with a peripheral glucose of 80 mg/dL. CSF protein is elevated to 200 mg/dL. CSF Gram stain is pending. Which of the following is the correct treatment option?

options.label: A
options.text: Begin acyclovir for herpes simplex encephalitis

options.label: B
options.text: Obtain emergency magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) scan before beginning treatment.

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: Begin high-dose penicillin for meningococcal meningitis

questions.correct_answer: C. Begin dexamethasone, followed by ceftriaxone and vancomycin, for pneumococcal meningitis

questions.text: During pregnancy, the most likely change in maternal levels of thyroxine-binding globulin (TBG), total thyroxine (T4), and total triiodothyronine (T3) are which of the following?

options.text: TBG levels rise, but total thyroxine (T4) and total triiodothyronine (T3) fall

options.label: C
options.text: TBG levels and total thyroxine (T4) rise while total triiodothyronine (T3) remains unchanged

questions.correct_answer: A. TBG levels, total thyroxine (T4), and total triiodothyronine (T3) all rise
